title: Events tomorrow - DEC. 22: Cosmology Education and Research Training Centre (COSMOS-Mysuru) of Indian Institute of Astrophysics (IIA), Mysuru Readers and Arivu - Star of Mysore
summary:
Events tomorrow – DEC. 22: Cosmology Education and Research Training Centre (COSMOS-Mysuru)

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: Star of Mysore

This event features a public talk titled ‘Why Science Writing in Kannada?’ by Kollegala Sharma, a retired Chief Scientist from CFTRI, scheduled for 4:30 PM.

  • Event hosted by the Cosmology Education and Research Training Centre (COSMOS-Mysuru).
  • Speaker: Kollegala Sharma, retd. Chief Scientist, CFTRI and Editor of Kutuhali.
  • Focus on the importance of scientific communication in regional languages.
“Science writing in Kannada encourages wider accessibility and knowledge dissemination.” – Kollegala Sharma

Attendees are encouraged to join for an insightful discussion on promoting science writing in local languages, enhancing knowledge sharing in the community.

title: PM Modi meets 101-year-old ex-IFS officer in Kuwait after granddaughter's request - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Modi meets 101-year-old ex-IFS officer in Kuwait after granddaughter's request

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi met a 101-year-old former Indian Foreign Service officer in Kuwait after his granddaughter requested a meeting on social media.

  • PM Modi's visit is notable as it is the first by an Indian Prime Minister to Kuwait in 43 years.
  • The meeting was initiated by a social media request from Mangal Sain Handa’s granddaughter.
  • Mangal Sain Handa has a significant legacy as a former IFS officer.
  • Kuwait has a large Indian diaspora, constituting 21% of its total population.
“This is an experience of a lifetime. PM Modi said he especially came here to meet him (my father). We are grateful to Prime Minister Modi.” - Dilip Handa

PM Modi's visit emphasizes the strong ties between India and Kuwait, highlighting historical connections and mutual interests.
newTitle: PM Modi meets 101-year-old ex-IFS officer in Kuwait after granddaughter's request

Samsung's S95 series OLED TVs, known for their exceptional picture quality and advanced QD-OLED technology, are set to continue evolving with the upcoming S95F model slated for release in 2025. While the current S95D has already earned accolades as one of the best TVs of 2024, the next iteration promises enhancements in AI-driven picture processing, smarter interfaces, and potentially new screen sizes.

title: Reliance Industries arm to acquire 45% stake in Health Alliance Group for $10 million | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Reliance Industries to Acquire 45% Stake in Health Alliance Group

Publication Date: December 21, 2023

Source: LiveMint

Reliance Digital Health Ltd, a subsidiary of Reliance Industries, is set to acquire a 45% equity stake in Health Alliance Group Inc. for $10 million. This investment aims to enhance healthcare access for underserved communities through a virtual diagnostic and care platform.

  • Reliance Industries announced the agreement on December 21, 2023.
  • The transaction is subject to customary closing conditions and is expected to finalize within two weeks.
  • No regulatory approvals are required for the acquisition.
  • Health Alliance Group specializes in technology-driven healthcare solutions targeting underserved populations.
“The investment will empower Reliance Digital to develop a virtual diagnostic and care platform.”

The acquisition reflects Reliance's commitment to improving healthcare accessibility and aligns with its digital health strategy.
newTitle: Reliance Industries to Acquire 45% Stake in Health Alliance Group

title: ISRO finds new partner in Europe to help with space exploration - Hindustan Times
summary:
ISRO Collaborates with ESA for Enhanced Space Exploration

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) and the European Space Agency (ESA) have forged a new collaboration aimed at advancing human space exploration. The two agencies signed a comprehensive agreement on Saturday to cooperate on astronaut training, mission implementation, and a variety of research experiments in space.

  • ISRO and ESA have signed a collaboration agreement for astronaut training and mission implementation.
  • The Axiom-4 mission will be among the first significant projects under this partnership.
  • The agreement covers human and biomedical research, space experiments, and educational outreach.
  • ISRO plans to expand its presence in space with upcoming projects like the Bharatiya Antariksh Station.
  • Both agencies have expressed satisfaction with the progress of the Axiom-4 mission.

Somanath highlighted ISRO's roadmap for human spaceflight, emphasizing the agency’s long-term vision for expanding its presence in space.

This partnership is set to open new avenues for scientific research and technology advancements in space exploration.
newTitle: ISRO Collaborates with ESA for Enhanced Space Exploration

title: Google exec says job which doesn't need a college degree is in high demand - Hindustan Times
summary:
High Demand for Data Analytics Jobs Without College Degrees

Publication Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The demand for data analytics jobs that do not require a college degree is rising, with the US Bureau of Labor Statistics predicting over 30% growth in the field over the next decade.

  • Data analysts can earn six-figure salaries without a traditional degree.
  • Google's Lisa Gevelber highlights the importance of data understanding in business decisions.
  • Skills in data analytics are highly sought after, emphasizing practical training over formal education.
  • The entry-level salary for data analysts averages around $93,000; experienced professionals can make up to $110,000 or more in certain sectors.
“The demand for people who understand data and can use it to guide important business decisions is huge.” - Lisa Gevelber

This trend emphasizes the growing importance of skill-based learning in the labor market.
newTitle: High Demand for Data Analytics Jobs Without College Degrees

summary:
Anand Mahindra Revives Interest in Mysore Sandal Soap

Date: December 21, 2024
Source: Live Mint

Anand Mahindra, the chairperson of Mahindra Group, expresses nostalgia for Mysore Sandal Soap, planning to purchase it again after sharing a video that highlights its production process.

“Overwhelmed by nostalgia upon seeing this clip. Delighted to see that it survives—and thrives. Going to start buying it again and inhaling the fragrance of tradition!” — Anand Mahindra

Mysore Sandal Soap Expansion Plans

The iconic Mysore Sandal Soap, produced by Karnataka Soaps and Detergents Limited (KSDL), plans to add around 480 new distributors in 2025, aiming to broaden its market across India, especially in northern states.

  • Anand Mahindra reminisces about using Mysore Sandal Soap.
  • The soap is set to undergo product revamp with a new logo and tagline.
  • Major sales come from southern states, with Andhra Pradesh being the highest consumer.
  • KSDL reported its highest turnover in 40 years, reaching ₹1,500 crore.
newTitle: Anand Mahindra Revives Interest in Mysore Sandal Soap

title: Delhi Excise policy case: Delhi Lieutenant Governor gives nod to ED to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi Lieutenant Governor Approves Prosecution of Arvind Kejriwal in Excise Policy Case

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Ahead of the upcoming 2025 Delhi Assembly Polls, Delhi Lieutenant Governor V.K. Saxena has sanctioned the Enforcement Directorate to prosecute Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief and former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in the Delhi excise policy case.

  • The ED sought permission for the prosecution on December 5.
  • Senior AAP leader Atishi criticized the timing and intent behind the prosecution, suggesting it misleads the public.
  • The move follows months of investigations into allegations of corruption related to the excise policy.
  • The Delhi High Court has granted the ED additional time to respond to a petition challenging the trial court's decision regarding the case.
“If LG sir has given permission to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal ji, then what is the problem for ED in making the copy of the approval public? This news is being spread only to mislead people and distract them from the issues.” – Atishi

This decision raises significant political tensions as the Delhi Assembly elections approach, highlighting the ongoing controversy surrounding the excise policy.
newTitle: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Approves Prosecution of Arvind Kejriwal in Excise Policy Case

title: Human infections risk from H5N1 bird flu virus currently low: WHO - DTNEXT
summary:
Human Infections from H5N1 Bird Flu Virus Currently Low, Says WHO

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Xinhua News Agency

The World Health Organization (WHO) reports that the global public health risk from H5N1 bird flu viruses is currently low, although some occupationally exposed groups face varying risks.

  • The assessment is based on data highlighting human infections mainly arise from contact with infected animals.
  • As of 2024, 76 human cases have been documented, primarily among farm workers in the US.
  • No significant global public health impact despite a low total number of cases.
  • Animal-to-animal transmission persists, posing variable risks to farm workers based on local conditions.
  • The virus's potential for rapid adaptation raises concerns among experts.
  • Significant economic impacts on global poultry industries threaten food security.
  • The virus has widespread ecological consequences, affecting numerous bird and mammal species.
“Ongoing animal-to-animal transmission continues to pose a threat.” - Maria Van Kerkhove, WHO

In conclusion, while the risk to humans remains low, vigilance and collaboration are essential to monitor and mitigate the ongoing threat posed by the H5N1 virus.
newTitle: Human Infections from H5N1 Bird Flu Virus Currently Low, Says WHO

title: Not Stree 2, Kalki 2898 AD, or Fighter, this south hit is 2024's most-watched Indian film, sold 31 lakh tickets in a day - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pushpa 2: The Rule Becomes Most-Watched Indian Film of 2024

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

As 2024 comes to a close, the BookMyShow report reveals that Pushpa 2: The Rule has emerged as the most-watched Indian film of the year, selling a remarkable 31 lakh tickets on its opening day.

  • Pushpa 2: The Rule has 10.8 lakh solo viewers.
  • The film grossed over ₹1500 crore worldwide.
  • It is directed by Sukumar and stars Allu Arjun, Fahadh Faasil, and Rashmika Mandanna.
  • The film set a record for the highest-opening by an Indian film.
  • November 1 saw sales of 2.3 million tickets in 24 hours.
“The most watched Indian film of 2024 has done a business of over ₹1500 crore worldwide.”

This film not only highlights the cinematic success of the year but also the changing trends in audience preferences, where big-budget blockbusters continue to dominate.
newTitle: Pushpa 2: The Rule Becomes Most-Watched Indian Film of 2024

Date: Dec 21, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi has arrived in Kuwait for a two-day official visit to strengthen bilateral ties and discuss various cooperation agreements.

  • PM Modi was invited by Kuwaiti Emir Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah.
  • The visit aims to enhance defence and security cooperation between India and Kuwait.
  • Bilateral agreements related to investment and defense are expected to be finalized.
  • The partnership is seen as significant for regional stability and cooperation within the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC).
“I look forward to my meetings with His Highness the Amir... It would be an opportunity to chalk out a roadmap for a futuristic partnership for the benefit of our people and the region,” - PM Modi.

This visit marks a significant diplomatic engagement, reflecting the deep historical ties and mutual interests between India and Kuwait.
newTitle: PM Narendra Modi Arrives in Kuwait for Talks on Defence and Security

title: Wife's Financial Independence No Bar To Grant Alimony If It's Necessary To Secure Dignity & Social... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Grants Permanent Alimony to Secure Financial Independence Post-Divorce

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has ruled that maintenance can be granted even if a party is financially independent, emphasizing the necessity to uphold dignity and financial stability following divorce.

The Court awarded Rs 50 lakhs as permanent alimony to a wife, taking into consideration the length of marriage, earning capacities, and the emotional and financial burdens faced during litigation.

  • The Supreme Court emphasized that financial independence does not negate the need for maintenance.
  • The Court granted Rs 50 lakhs as permanent alimony for dignity and stability.
  • Factors for awarding alimony include marriage duration, earning capacities, and contributions to the marriage.
  • Past case references were made to reinforce the judgment's rationale.
“The financial independence of a party does not preclude the High Court from granting maintenance if it is necessary to secure dignity...”

This ruling reaffirms the position that alimony is essential for post-divorce sustenance while considering the well-being of dependent parties.
newTitle: Supreme Court Grants Permanent Alimony to Secure Financial Independence Post-Divorce

title: Kazan Attack: Massive Fire Erupts As 8 Drones Fly Into Buildings In Russian City, Chilling Videos Surface - News18
summary:
Kazan Drone Attack: Buildings Targeted in Chilling Assault

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: News18

Russia experienced a major attack in its city of Kazan as a series of eight drone strikes targeted high-rise buildings. The strikes reportedly occurred in rapid succession, hitting several multi-story buildings.

  • The Russian government accused Ukraine of being behind the drone assault.
  • Emergency response efforts were launched and residents evacuated from the affected buildings.
  • Kazan airport operations were temporarily suspended due to the attack.
  • Russian air defenses managed to down one drone, but others penetrated defenses.
  • This attack follows a recent drone and missile assault by Russia on Ukrainian cities.
"The Russian government accused Ukraine of being behind the drone assault."

The drone attack on Kazan highlights the ongoing tensions and hostilities between Russia and Ukraine, further escalating the conflict.
newTitle: Kazan Drone Attack: Buildings Targeted in Chilling Assault

title: Ambedkar row: Amit Shah bitten by 'rabid dog,' says Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge - Deccan Herald
summary:
Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge Criticizes Amit Shah's Remarks on Ambedkar

Published: 21 December 2024, 08:50 IST

Karnataka Minister for IT and BT, Priyank Kharge, condemned Union Home Minister Amit Shah's comments regarding B.R. Ambedkar, accusing him of being out of touch with the principles of equality.

  • Kharge stated that Shah has been "bitten by a rabid dog" in his views about Ambedkar.
  • The minister emphasized the importance of Ambedkar's philosophy for achieving political, social, and economic equality.
  • Shah's remarks have stirred controversy, with accusations that the Congress party is anti-Ambedkar and anti-reservation.
"The more Ambedkar and Basava philosophy grow, the RSS ideology will diminish," - Priyank Kharge
newTitle: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge Criticizes Amit Shah's Remarks on Ambedkar

title: 7 amazing, unseen photos of galaxy clusters shared by NASA - India.com
summary:
7 Amazing, Unseen Photos of Galaxy Clusters Shared by NASA

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India.com

This article showcases seven incredible photographs of galaxy clusters, highlighting their beauty and the scientific wonders they represent.

  • Perseus Cluster: Hosts a supermassive black hole that emits eerie sound waves, visible in X-ray and optical light.
  • Coma Cluster: A densely packed cluster with over 1,000 galaxies, offering valuable insights into galactic evolution.
  • Bullet Cluster: Provides strong evidence of dark matter through the collision of two galaxy clusters.
  • Abell 1689: Acts like a cosmic magnifying glass, bending light from distant galaxies.
  • MACS J1149.5+2223: Known for its gravitational lensing effects that reveal a distant supernova.
  • Pandora's Cluster (Abell 2744): A complex cosmic collision with multiple merged galaxy clusters.
  • El Gordo Cluster: The largest and hottest galaxy cluster observed in the distant universe.
“These images reveal the intricate and stunning nature of our universe, showcasing both its beauty and complexity.”

The article celebrates the marvels of the universe through these captivating images, inviting readers to explore the cosmos.
newTitle: Discover Stunning Images of Galaxy Clusters Shared by NASA

title: 'Notorious' stand, beer towers, and Boxing Day madness: MCG braces for Australia vs India - The Times of India
summary:
Notorious stand, beer towers, and Boxing Day madness: MCG braces for Australia vs India

Publication Date: December 26, 2023 | Source: Times of India

On December 26, the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) is set to host a sold-out crowd of nearly 100,000 for the highly-anticipated Boxing Day Test between Australia and India. Security measures have been ramped up in response to the expected rowdy atmosphere, particularly from a notorious group known for their loud behavior.

  • Over 100,000 spectators expected for the match, with additional security personnel deployed.
  • Security staff count increased from 10 to up to 20 per block to manage the crowd.
  • Tickets for resale are fetching steep premiums, with prices rising from 30 AUD to upwards of 150 AUD.
  • Local marketplaces buzzing with fans reselling tickets, creating a festive and chaotic environment.
"They just come and drink. That loud bunch in those blue blocks. Beer just flows and expect the beer glass towers to get taller as the game progresses." - Security guard at MCG

The excitement leading up to the match showcases the vibrant cricket culture in Australia, with festivities continuing through the New Year.
newTitle: MCG Prepares for Australia vs India: Anticipating Boxing Day Chaos

title: Trouble For Arvind Kejriwal, Delhi Lt Governor Allows Probe Agency To Prosecute Him - NDTV
GST Council Meeting Live Updates: Defers insurance overhaul, recommends 18% tax on used EVs and smaller cars - BusinessLine
Human infections risk from H5N1 bird flu virus currently low: WHO - Social News XYZ
summary:
Human infections risk from H5N1 bird flu virus currently low: WHO

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: SocialNews.XYZ

The World Health Organization (WHO) has assessed that the global public health risk of H5N1 bird flu is currently low, with risks for occupationally exposed groups ranging from low to moderate.

  • Human infections are mostly linked to contact with infected animals or contaminated environments.
  • As of December 2024, there have been 76 documented human cases of H5N1, with 61 in the US.
  • The virus remains primarily a poultry pathogen without evidence of human-to-human transmission.
  • Animal-to-animal transmission continues, particularly in regions without effective preventive measures.
  • The economic impact on global poultry industries is significant, threatening food security.
"The potential for the virus to adapt rapidly continues to be a concern," stated Maria Van Kerkhove, WHO's expert on emerging diseases.

While the immediate risk for human infection remains low, authorities urge continued vigilance and collaboration to monitor H5N1's impact.
newTitle: WHO Reports Low Risk of Human Infections from H5N1 Bird Flu

title: Rival protests over South Korea's impeached President Yoon held in Seoul - CNA
summary:
Rival Protests Erupt in Seoul Over Impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol

Publication Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: Channel News Asia

On December 21, 2024, demonstrators supporting and opposing President Yoon Suk Yeol held rival protests in Seoul, following Yoon's impeachment over his declaration of martial law.

  • Protests were held several hundred meters apart in Gwanghwamun.
  • Tens of thousands of anti-Yoon protesters called for his arrest while expressing concerns over democracy.
  • Several thousand pro-Yoon supporters opposed his removal and supported the restoration of his powers.
  • The National Election Commission denied Yoon's claims regarding election hacking and pro-North Korean sympathizers.
"I wanted to ask Yoon how he could do this to a democracy in the 21st century... he should step down." - Cho Sung-hyo, 27

The protests highlight the deep divisions in South Korean society over the political future of Yoon Suk Yeol, as debates continue about the implications of his martial law declaration.
newTitle: Rival Protests Erupt in Seoul Over Impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol
